result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan James Baade #00591983 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
02:46 PM Defendant Ryan James Baade   #00591983 in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State argues sentencing - 9 month county jail credit for 131 days - unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment on each count.  Atty Kirkpatrick argues sentencing requests 6 months on each count.  

Court:  9 months county jail with credit for 131 days as time served with good time and huber - unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment
   count 3:  9 months county jail with credit for 131 days as time served concurrent count 1 with good time and huber - unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment
As per request of Attorney Kirkpatrick the 01/22/2019 hearing time has been changed from 11am to 2:30 PM.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 22, 2019 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 22, 2019 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court's response to DOC LETC received 07-15-16.

from DOC Corrections Sentencing Associate - Janelle Nehring requesting clarification  on the probationary term order for Ct. 1 & 3.  Also requesting clarification on #00591983 in the case name - DOC doesn't recognize the number or understand its significance.  (NOTE:  The number is the defendant's DOC number which is needed when sending correspondence to DOC AND the defendant while he is incarcerated.)

DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts, DEF pleads NC to CT#1 and 3 found guilty, Dismiss and read-in CT#2.
Court on CT#1 withholds sentence 2 years probation consecutive to any sentence currently serving, costs $443.00   Absolute Sobriety,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Court on CT#3 withholds sentence 2 years probation concurrent to ct #1,  costs $453.00   Absolute Sobriety,  complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent,   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.

Defendant Ryan James Baade   #00591983 in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Defendant Ryan James Baade   #00591983 in custody appears by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint,
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
